ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When he ran away to the fully laden ship
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When he fled on the laden ship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Call to mind when he fled to the laden ship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When he left towards the laden ship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When he ran to the laden ship:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When he ran away to a ship completely laden,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: when he ran away to the laden ship
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When he fled unto the laden ship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He fled to the overloaded ship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Recall what time he ran away Unto a laden ship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When he absconded toward the laden ship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When he ran away (like a slave from captivity) to the ship (fully) laden,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When he ran to the laden ship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He ran away to the laden ship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When he fled to the laden boat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:140] when he fled to the laden ship — after he became furious with his people, as the chastisement which he had promised them did not come down on them; so he boarded the ship, which then stopped out in the deep sea. The seamen said, ‘There is a runaway slave here [upon this ship] who has fled from his master: a casting of lots should expose him!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When he fled) from his folk; and it is said: when he abandoned his folk (unto the laden ship) which was about to sail,
